page.title: 08FARMING N.BEDS/S.W.CAMBS
page.content: { TYPES OF FARMING}- mostly arable. Heavy clay soil. Chief crops wheat, barley, sugarbeet, oilseed rape. Some crops for seeds _ parsnips, turnips, radishes. Most acres under wheat due to EEC Grain buying policy. Use of large hedged fields _ few trees _ some pheasant coverts. Much use of fertilisers and insecticides. Aerial spraying of crops. { LIVESTOCK}- chiefly beef cattle.1985 one farm rearing bullocks for bully-beef. Some dairying, sheep, pigs, goats, horses. {BREEDS OF CATTLE}for beef _ Hereford cross Freisians. 1st year cattle bred from Aberdeen Angus bull to produce smaller calves. 2nd year cattle _ use of continental bulls by artificial insemination to get bigger calves. Sheep reared for meat as subsidiary income.
